prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 1
Name: Florence Niedler
Description: A nurse who works at Hertz Hospital. Has a worrying tendency to offer unnecessary treatments to everyone she meets.
Character 2
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A mysterious young woman brought to the High Prosecutors' Offices by Florence Niedler. She appears to have lost her memory, but...
Character 3
Name: Hilda Hertz
Description: The head of Hertz Hospital. Carried out the preliminary inspection of the victim in this case.
Character 4
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. She is a highly talented prosecutor, and is currently working with Interpol.
Character 5
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Character 6
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 7
Name: Rosie Ringer
Description: The victim in this case. She was a defense attorney, and served on the Committee alongside Judge Gavèlle.
Character 8
Name: Excelsius Winner
Description: Former chief prosecutor, current Chairman of the Committee, and Eustace Winner's father. Has a tendency to burst into tears over nothing.
Character 9
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co. He's trying to get me to become a defense attorney.
Character 10
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A high school student looking to become a forensic investigator, and the younger sister of my former boss.
Character 11
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: A freelance photojournalist who I've met in the past. Known for her ability to sniff out scoops and snap them with her trusty camera.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Yatagarasu Pin
Description: The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears.
Evidence 2
Name: Jammin' Ninja Mask
Description: A mask modeled on the Jammin' Ninja's face. Made of cheap plastic.
Evidence 3
Name: Letter
Description: A letter Kay was carrying. It is addressed to her.
Evidence 4
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: A book of promises Kay made to her father when she was a little girl. What was it doing in the Committee chamber?
Evidence 5
Name: Ticket Stub
Description: Stub from a ticket granting entry to the viewing platform on top of the Bigg Building.
Evidence 6
Name: Magenta Flower
Description: A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Also known as a corsage. A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Torn from the victim's clothes.
Evidence 7
Name: Bigg Building Pamphlet
Description: Contains a cross-section of the building and a plan of the viewing platform.
Evidence 8
Name: Kay's Recollections
Description: Kay remembers a person coming from beyond the concession stand and pushing her off of the building.
Evidence 9
Name: Candelabrum
Description: A three-armed candle holder that may have been the murder weapon, judging by the wounds to the the victim's chest. A three-armed candle holder found by the victim's body. Made to look like the murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Keycard
Description: A keycard that grants entry to the Committee chamber. Found in the victim's hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Initial findings of Dr. Hilda Hertz. Cause of death: Stab wounds to chest. Head injury sustained post mortem. Death occurred as a result of a heavy blow to the head with a circular object. Chest wounds inflicted post-mortem.
Evidence 12
Name: Keycard Record
Description: Record of keycards used to enter the Committee chamber.
Evidence 13
Name: Victim's Letter
Description: A letter that appears to have been written to the victim by Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Broken Plushie
Description: The stuffed animal we originally found in the Zheng Fa presidential plane. Missing its left horn. Fitted with a recording device that captured part of a conversation. Based on the conversation, one of the people recorded was identified by having a prominent burn.
Evidence 15
Name: Masks
Description: A selection of various masks was kept on a rack. Each participant in the auction wore one.
Evidence 16
Name: Ringleader's Appearance
Description: Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Age and gender could not be discerned. Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Also had a tattoo on the part of their face the mask didn't cover.
Evidence 17
Name: Ms. Hart's Picture
Description: A photograph of the mysterious figure in the red raincoat. Click here for details. [caption] The figure's left hand is stained with blood. The figure is in the storeroom, walking towards a ladder that goes upwards. [info] The assult of Ms. Crane took place just before this photo was taken.
Evidence 18
Name: Ms. Hart's Statement
Description: Ms. Hart's observations about what happened during the mysterious auction. [info] Illicit auction held in Bigg Building. Items on sale were mainly items of police evidence related to homicide cases.
Eleven attendees altogether. All were wearing masks.
Auction continued even after Ringer's murder, but the sound of the auctioneer's hammer could no longer be heard.
Evidence 19
Name: Elevator Blood
Description: Blood was detected on the secret elevator. It looks like it dripped through to the floor below.
['Lotta:\nIt was a black market auction, after all. They followed a fairly detailed procedure. First, the participants entered the storeroom from the viewin\' platform one at a time. When they got in, they each took one of those masks on the wall over there... Funny thing \'bout those masks... They\'re all equipped with voice changers. Itty bitty ones. That way they wouldn\'t be recognized. They wanted to protect their... "an anemone"?\nEma:\nYou mean... their "anonymity"?\nLotta:\nYeah, that\'s it! Their "anomnintany"!\nEdgeworth:\n(Why not just say "identity" and make things easier for all of us...?)\nLotta:\nAfter puttin\' on the mask, they\'d go down the lift, and the next feller would come right in. On the way back, it was the exact same thing, but in reverse. They\'d come up one by one, return the mask, and head up outta the storeroom.', "Ema:\nWell then, let's head on down!\nRay:\nOh, have we decided on our next destination? Heeeey, Kay!\nKay:\nY-Yes, Mr. Shields!\nRay:\nWe wouldn't want you to get lost, so make sure you stay real close to Uncle Ray, kay?\nKay:\nRight! I'll follow you closely, Mr. Shields.\nEdgeworth:\n(These two... Since when did they get along like that?)\nInvestigation Complete\nApril 5, 7:43 PMGrand TowerP.I.C. Meeting Room"]
Evidence 20
Name: Clothes Box
Description: Box in which the killer hid the body. Traces of blood were detected inside.
Evidence 21
Name: Committee Chamber Blood
Description: Blood found in the Committee chamber. Was it placed there to hide the existence of the storeroom?
Evidence 22
Name: Red Raincoat
Description: Worn by the victim, whose fingerprints and blood were found on the hood.
Evidence 23
Name: Nurse Niedler's Statement
Description: Niedler's description of how she swapped places with Rosie Ringer.
Evidence 24
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The victim used her keycard and entered this room with the culprit.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: Then, the culprit stabbed the victim in the chest with the candelabra, killing her.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: Shouldn't the letter make it obvious who the culprit is?
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: Of course, the crime scene was right here in this room: the P.I.C. meeting room.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: The proof is the bloodstain we found here in the meeting room! That settles it, Miles Edgeworth.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to pick one pair where the evidence and testimony don't align.

First, I'll go through each testimony and check the corresponding evidence to see if there's a conflict. Let's start with the testimonies from Franziska:

Testimony 0: The victim used her keycard and entered this room with the culprit.
Testimony 1: The culprit stabbed her in the chest with the candelabra, killing her.
Testimony 2: The letter should reveal the culprit.
Testimony 3: The crime scene was in the P.I.C. meeting room.
Testimony 4: The bloodstain in the meeting room proves it.

Now, looking at the evidences. Let me check the relevant ones:

Evidence 11 (Autopsy Report): Says cause of death was a head injury from a circular object, and the chest wounds were post-mortem. So the fatal injury was the head, not the chest stab. That contradicts Testimony 1 which claims the victim was killed by the chest stab with the candelabra. 

Evidence 7 (Bigg Building Pamphlet) shows the viewing platform's layout, but maybe not directly related here. 

Evidence 19 (Elevator Blood) and 21 (Committee Chamber Blood) mention blood in the meeting room. Testimony 4 refers to that blood as proof, but if the actual murder scene was elsewhere, like the viewing platform or storeroom, then the blood in the meeting room might be a red herring. 

Looking at Evidence 17 (Ms. Hart's Picture) caption says the assault happened just before the photo, which was in the storeroom. Also, the autopsy report's post-mortem chest wounds suggest the stabbing happened after death, so maybe the murder was the head injury elsewhere. 

So Testimony 3 and 4 by Franziska state the crime scene was the meeting room, but Evidence 11's autopsy says the致命的头部伤害可能发生在其他地方，比如观景平台。而委员会会议室的血迹可能是转移现场的证据。因此，证据11和证词3或4可能矛盾。

具体来说，Testimony 3说犯罪现场在P.I.C会议室，但根据尸检报告（Evidence 11），致命伤是头部的打击，而胸部的刺伤是死后造成的。如果致命伤发生在会议室之外（比如观景平台），那么Franziska的证词关于犯罪现场的位置就是错误的。因此，证据11和Testimony 3或4存在矛盾。 

另外，Testimony 1中提到凶手用烛台刺杀，但尸检报告显示胸部伤口是死后造成的，所以致命伤不是烛台，而是圆形物体的头部打击。这直接与Testimony1矛盾。因此，证据11和Testimony1是矛盾的。

现在需要确定用户的问题需要选哪一对。根据选项，可能选Evidence11和Testimony1的矛盾。
</think>

cot:
Okay, let me tackle this problem step by step. So, I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. My job is to look through them and find one such pair.

First, I'll start by reviewing the testimonies to understand what each is stating. The testimonies here are from Franziska, and they're about the murder of Rosie Ringer. Let's go through each testimony one by one:

Testimony 0: "I will concede your argument. The murder occurred in the storeroom, correct?" – Franziska is agreeing that the murder happened in the storeroom.

Testimony 1: "That would mean the culprit is someone who participated in the auction." – So the killer was part of the auction.

Testimony 2: "If that photographer is correct, the victim was the Conductor, and the culprit was a customer." – Here, Franziska is saying the victim was the auction's conductor, and the killer was a customer.

Testimony 3: "The culprit waited for the victim in the storeroom, where the goods were delivered." – The killer was waiting in the storeroom.

Testimony 4: "I believe the crime occurred after the auction ended." – The murder happened after the auction concluded.

Testimony 5: "Then, they stabbed the victim in the chest with the candelabra in the storeroom." – The method of killing was stabbing with a candelabrum in the storeroom.

Now, looking at the evidences, I need to find which one contradicts any of these statements.

Let me go through the evidences:

Evidence 11 (Autopsy Report): "Cause of death: Stab wounds to chest. Head injury sustained post mortem. Death occurred as a result of a heavy blow to the head with a circular object. Chest wounds inflicted post-mortem."

Wait, this is crucial. The autopsy report states that the chest wounds were inflicted post-mortem. That means the victim was already dead when the stab wounds were made. The cause of death was the head injury from a circular object. So the actual killing blow was the head injury, not the chest stab. 

Looking back at Testimony 5, Franziska says the victim was stabbed in the chest with the candelabra in the storeroom, implying that the chest wounds were the cause of death. But according to the autopsy report (Evidence 11), those chest wounds were done after she was already dead. Therefore, the chest stab wasn't the cause of death, contradicting Franziska's testimony that the murder was done via the candelabrum stab. 

Another possible contradiction is Testimony 4 where Franziska says the crime occurred after the auction ended. Evidence 17 (Ms. Hart's Picture) mentions that the assault took place just before the photo was taken, and the auction continued even after the murder. The info in Evidence 18 (Ms. Hart's Statement) says the auction continued after Ringer's murder. So if the murder happened before the auction ended, then Testimony 4's claim that it happened after the auction ended would be contradicted by the evidence that the auction continued post-murder, implying the murder was during or before the auction ended. 

But let me check the details again. Testimony 4 says the crime occurred after the auction ended, but Evidence 18 says the auction continued even after the murder. That means the murder happened while the auction was still ongoing. So Testimony 4's timing is off, which would be a contradiction. 

Wait, but let me confirm the exact wording. Testimony 4: "I believe the crime occurred after the auction ended." Evidence 18's info: "Auction continued even after Ringer's murder, but the sound of the auctioneer's hammer could no longer be heard." So the auction continued, meaning that the murder happened before the auction ended. Therefore, Testimony 4's assertion that it was after the auction ended is contradicted by Evidence 18. However, the user's question requires picking only one pair. 

Alternatively, Evidence 11 and Testimony 5 are also in conflict. Since the testimony claims the candelabrum (which is the three-armed candle holder, Evidence 9) was used to stab her in the chest, causing death, but the autopsy says that the chest wounds were post-mortem. Therefore, the actual cause of death was the head injury, not the stab wounds. Thus, the testimony's claim about how she was killed (stabbed in the chest with candelabrum) is contradicted by the autopsy report which says that those chest wounds were done after death. Hence, the murder weapon wasn't the candelabrum but whatever caused the head injury. 

So between these two possibilities (Evidence 11 vs Testimony 5 and Evidence 18 vs Testimony 4), which is the correct one?

The user's previous examples had similar contradictions, like in the first question where Evidence 22 (Used Blowtorch) and Testimony 2 contradicted each other. The key is to find the most direct contradiction. 

In this case, Testimony 5 directly states that the murder was done by stabbing with the candelabrum in the chest. But Evidence 11 says the chest wounds were post-mortem, so the actual killing was from the head injury. Therefore, Testimony 5's assertion about the cause of death via the candelabrum is contradicted by Evidence 11. 

Another point: Evidence 9 describes the candelabrum as "may have been the murder weapon, judging by the wounds to the victim's chest." However, the autopsy report (Evidence 11) clarifies that the chest wounds were post-mortem, so the candelabrum wasn't the murder weapon. Therefore, the testimony's reliance on the candelabrum as the murder weapon is incorrect. 

Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 11 and Testimony 5. But let me check the numbering again. The user lists the evidences, and Testimony 5 is the fifth one (starting from 0), so Testimony 5 is numbered 5. The evidence is 11. So the JSON would be {"evidence":11, "testimony":5}

Wait, but the user's previous example had a similar situation where the testimony was Testimony 1 (index 1) and Evidence 11 (autopsy report) contradicted Testimony 1's claim that the victim was stabbed to death with the candelabrum. Let me check the current Testimonies again.

Looking at the current Testimonies provided:

Testimony 0: Murder in storeroom

Testimony 1: Culprit was auction participant

Testimony 2: Victim was conductor, culprit a customer

Testimony 3: Culprit waited in storeroom

Testimony 4: Crime occurred after auction ended

Testimony 5: They stabbed victim in chest with candelabra in storeroom.

So Testimony 5 is the fifth one (index 5). The autopsy report (Evidence 11) states that the chest wounds were post-mortem, so the actual cause was the head injury. Therefore, the testimony's claim that the murder was done via the candelabrum's stab is wrong. 

Alternatively, Testimony 4 and Evidence 18 (Ms. Hart's Statement) also contradict, but the user might prefer the more direct contradiction regarding the cause of death. Since the question requires only one pair, I should pick the most clear one.

Therefore, the correct answer is Evidence 11 and Testimony 5.
</think>

Evidence 23
Name: Nurse Niedler's Statement
Description: Niedler's description of how she swapped places with Rosie Ringer.
Evidence 24
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Ms. Crane went to the black market auction as a customer.
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 1
Testimony: The red raincoat was one of the items up for auction...
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 2
Testimony: We believe that she left her seat after winning the bid for it.
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 3
Testimony: The only exit from the storeroom is the hatch that leads to the viewing platform.
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 4
Testimony: Ms. Crane went out to the viewing platform, where she was attacked by Kay Faraday.
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 5
Testimony: That was how she met her end. And that concludes my summary of the case.
Person: Gravelle

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by reviewing the provided information carefully.

First, the characters, evidences, and testimonies are listed. The task is to identify one pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other. 

Looking at the testimonies provided by Gravelle (Testimonies 0-5), Testimony 4 states that Rosie Ringer (the victim) was attacked by Kay Faraday on the viewing platform. The key points here are the location (viewing platform) and the perpetrator (Kay).

Now, I'll go through the evidences to find any that contradict this. Evidence 17 is Ms. Hart's Picture, which has a caption mentioning a figure in the storeroom. The info note says the assault on Ms. Crane (the victim) happened just before this photo was taken. If the photo shows the assault occurring in the storeroom, that directly contradicts the testimony that places the attack on the viewing platform. 

Additionally, Testimony 3 from Gravelle mentions the only exit from the storeroom is the hatch to the viewing platform. If the assault was in the storeroom, then the body or evidence related to the attack should be there, but according to the autopsy report (Evidence 11), the cause of death was a head injury from a circular object inflicted post-mortem, with chest wounds also post-mortem. However, the main contradiction here is the location of the assault as per the testimony versus the evidence from the photo.

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 17 (which shows the assault in the storeroom) and Testimony 4 (which claims it happened on the viewing platform). That should be the conflicting pair.
</think>

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 1
Name: Florence Niedler
Description: A nurse who works at Hertz Hospital. Has a worrying tendency to offer unnecessary treatments to everyone she meets.
Character 2
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A mysterious young woman brought to the High Prosecutors' Offices by Florence Niedler. She appears to have lost her memory, but...
Character 3
Name: Hilda Hertz
Description: The head of Hertz Hospital. Carried out the preliminary inspection of the victim in this case.
Character 4
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. She is a highly talented prosecutor, and is currently working with Interpol.
Character 5
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Character 6
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 7
Name: Rosie Ringer
Description: The victim in this case. She was a defense attorney, and served on the Committee alongside Judge Gavèlle.
Character 8
Name: Excelsius Winner
Description: Former chief prosecutor, current Chairman of the Committee, and Eustace Winner's father. Has a tendency to burst into tears over nothing.
Character 9
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: Senior partner at Edgeworth and Co. He's trying to get me to become a defense attorney.
Character 10
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A high school student looking to become a forensic investigator, and the younger sister of my former boss.
Character 11
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: A freelance photojournalist who I've met in the past. Known for her ability to sniff out scoops and snap them with her trusty camera.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Yatagarasu Pin
Description: The Yatagarasu pin that Kay always wears.
Evidence 2
Name: Jammin' Ninja Mask
Description: A mask modeled on the Jammin' Ninja's face. Made of cheap plastic.
Evidence 3
Name: Letter
Description: A letter Kay was carrying. It is addressed to her.
Evidence 4
Name: Promise Notebook
Description: A book of promises Kay made to her father when she was a little girl. What was it doing in the Committee chamber?
Evidence 5
Name: Ticket Stub
Description: Stub from a ticket granting entry to the viewing platform on top of the Bigg Building.
Evidence 6
Name: Magenta Flower
Description: A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Also known as a corsage. A magenta flower made of fabric that is usually worn on the chest as a decoration. Torn from the victim's clothes.
Evidence 7
Name: Bigg Building Pamphlet
Description: Contains a cross-section of the building and a plan of the viewing platform.
Evidence 8
Name: Kay's Recollections
Description: Kay remembers a person coming from beyond the concession stand and pushing her off of the building.
Evidence 9
Name: Candelabrum
Description: A three-armed candle holder that may have been the murder weapon, judging by the wounds to the the victim's chest. A three-armed candle holder found by the victim's body. Made to look like the murder weapon.
Evidence 10
Name: Keycard
Description: A keycard that grants entry to the Committee chamber. Found in the victim's hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Initial findings of Dr. Hilda Hertz. Cause of death: Stab wounds to chest. Head injury sustained post mortem. Death occurred as a result of a heavy blow to the head with a circular object. Chest wounds inflicted post-mortem.
Evidence 12
Name: Keycard Record
Description: Record of keycards used to enter the Committee chamber.
Evidence 13
Name: Victim's Letter
Description: A letter that appears to have been written to the victim by Kay.
Evidence 14
Name: Broken Plushie
Description: The stuffed animal we originally found in the Zheng Fa presidential plane. Missing its left horn. Fitted with a recording device that captured part of a conversation. Based on the conversation, one of the people recorded was identified by having a prominent burn.
Evidence 15
Name: Masks
Description: A selection of various masks was kept on a rack. Each participant in the auction wore one.
Evidence 16
Name: Ringleader's Appearance
Description: Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Age and gender could not be discerned. Ringleader wore a white jacket, white gloves, a magenta flower, and a mask. Also had a tattoo on the part of their face the mask didn't cover.
Evidence 17
Name: Ms. Hart's Picture
Description: A photograph of the mysterious figure in the red raincoat. Click here for details. [caption] The figure's left hand is stained with blood. The figure is in the storeroom, walking towards a ladder that goes upwards. [info] The assult of Ms. Crane took place just before this photo was taken.
Evidence 18
Name: Ms. Hart's Statement
Description: Ms. Hart's observations about what happened during the mysterious auction. [info] Illicit auction held in Bigg Building. Items on sale were mainly items of police evidence related to homicide cases.
Eleven attendees altogether. All were wearing masks.
Auction continued even after Ringer's murder, but the sound of the auctioneer's hammer could no longer be heard.
Evidence 19
Name: Elevator Blood
Description: Blood was detected on the secret elevator. It looks like it dripped through to the floor below.
Evidence 20
Name: Clothes Box
Description: Box in which the killer hid the body. Traces of blood were detected inside.
Evidence 21
Name: Committee Chamber Blood
Description: Blood found in the Committee chamber. Was it placed there to hide the existence of the storeroom?
Evidence 22
Name: Red Raincoat
Description: Worn by the victim, whose fingerprints and blood were found on the hood.
Evidence 23
Name: Nurse Niedler's Statement
Description: Niedler's description of how she swapped places with Rosie Ringer.
Evidence 24
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Details of a murder case from eighteen years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: When the body was found, there were three wounds in Ms. Crane's chest.
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 1
Testimony: I'm sure you're well aware what kind of wounds these were, right?
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 2
Testimony: Yes, she was stabbed in the heart with the three-pronged candelabra.
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 3
Testimony: Is there any person who could survive such an injury?
Person: Gravelle
Testimony 4
Testimony: Please take a close look at the autopsy report. Can you still say the same thing after reading it?
Person: Gravelle

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me tackle this problem step by step. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and they want to find a pair where an evidence contradicts a testimony. The answer needs to be in the specified JSON format, and only one pair is required.

First, I need to look through the testimonies and evidences to spot any contradictions. The testimonies here are all from Gravelle. Testimony 0 says that the victim had three chest wounds from a candelabra, leading to death. Testimony 2 reiterates that she was stabbed with the three-pronged candelabra. 

Now, looking at the evidences, Evidence 11 is the Autopsy Report. Its description states that the cause of death was a head injury from a circular object, and the chest wounds were inflicted post-mortem. That's key because Gravelle's testimony claims the chest wounds (from the candelabra) caused death, but the autopsy says those wounds happened after death, and the actual cause was the head injury. 

So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 (and possibly Testimony 0) and Evidence 11. The testimony asserts the candelabra stabs were the lethal cause, but the autopsy evidence shows those wounds weren't the cause of death. The correct pair would be Evidence 11 and Testimony 2. Let me double-check the numbers: Testimony 2 is index 2 (since they start at 0), so the JSON should be {"evidence": 11, "testimony": 2}.
</think>
